title: ADA trading metaverse
description: Investments in appreciating or dividend paying assets have been the preserve of the wealthy; cryptocurrency and NFTs can redress the balance

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal will need more details like :

Cost breakdown and implementation plan,
milestones,
timelines  and verifiable links to given experience.

I strongly disagree.
f6_assessments.q1:
No information was provided .
I strongly disagree
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal did not provide sufficient information to audit the progress and success of the proposal solution.

I disagree

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement presented in the proposal is based on imbalance in income classes, and presents fractional ownership of digitized real world assets as the solution. The idea is addressing the challenge through it's specific area of focus, but the connection between solution and problem could be further clarified. The solution is very broadly described and could mean many different things, at the moment the solution only describes a vague idea of a project concept. Does the proposer want to create a marketplace, or reach out to different asset owners in order to digitize and fraction their assets to put out on the market? And where, in that case? The proposal synchronize with the challenge, but it is currently too vague for me to adress properly in regards to what impact it will have. Especially since the funds applied for are of such a substantial amount of the total challenge budget allocation.
f6_assessments.q1:
It will be difficult to measure the potential success of the project, given that so little information is provided. It is still more of a vague idea of concept (the idea in itself is interesting and really good), than a detailed plan on how the proposer means to achieve it. The proposer asks for roughly 57% of the total challenge funds, but does not provide a detailed plan on how these funds will be allocated. It does exist an estimated timeframe of 3-6 months to explore the 'proof of concept', but that is the only information given. The proposer lists experience valuable to the proposal, but there is no way of verifying it via a website or LinkedIn profile, which would increase the credibility of the team substantially.  Questions that would needed to be answered in order for this proposal to be assessed more thoroughly: Is there more than one team member than the proposer? What is their expertise and experience? How will the funds be allocated? What does the team hope to achieve during the estimated timeframe (preferably with milestones included)? 
Based on the information given, I disagree that this proposal is likely to be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
Same problem as explained earlier. There needs to be a roadmap/detailed plan (complete with time horizon) in order for this project to be audited successfully. The level of transparency is not sufficient, since the proposal only feature a vague idea of a concept, with no suggestions as to how the community or retailers might follow the development process. 
It would be beneficial to include a list of measurements of success, for example 'by this point in time, we aim to have attained this goal (x amount of users etc)'. The information provided makes it near impossible for the 'outside' to audit the process of the project in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal problem statement and solution is not clear. What real world asset that can be used with NFT as proof of ownership? If the business model is to create an investment, how will you comply with the national securities commissions law? I believe that this proposal did not give out the information that addresses the challenge therefore I strongly disagree with this proposal
f6_assessments.q1: There are no information on the team members working on this project. Project with anonymous teams has a low chance of success. Moreover, there are no detail breakdown of the budget required. What and how do you plan to use the money? The proposer also fails to give information on the required manpower and resources to implement the project. Also, the proposer fails to provide the risks and challenges that the team might face during the development of the project.  The budget required is also too high. With the above argument, I strongly disagree with this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal doesn't have detailed roadmap of the project progress. Moreover there is no method for the community to receive updates on the project. In addition, the team members are anonymous therefore there is no one to be held accountable for. With the above arguments, I strongly disagree with this proposal

f6_assessments.q0: NFTs as fractional ownership falls within the scope of the challenge statement, however I would like to see the problem statement developed in more detail, similarly, the solution to the problem statement must be elaborated, I would like to see the mechanisms behind the NFT metapherse. Furthermore, the team should elaborate on the value added to the cardano ecosystem. The team should address how the project will scale in future and consider followup funding rounds.
f6_assessments.q1: The idea is good but the project requires further development. I would want to see links to LinkedIn or similar to provide additional detail/evidence about the team work history, education and past experiences. The team must breakdown the budget into identifiable items. Furthermore, a deeper explanation about the architecture and language for the implementation of the back end is required – example how will the project tie into existing payment rails and fiat currencies.
f6_assessments.q2: The team provided proposal provides a rough 6-month roadmap and single line budget. I would like to see the team develop and define Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) for the project – what does success look like in 6 to 9 months, how many financial products do you plan to release – set a goal and use it as a KPI.  Furthermore, I would like to see the team enhance the roadmap, develop and add milestones to provide deeper detail, for example, set milestones for creating the first financial product. As the project stands at the moment, I feel the project will be difficult to audit.

f6_assessments.q0:
While I see an excellent idea in tying NFT's to real world assets and I believe this could provide a means to drive business cases on Cardano, I am not clear on how this will drive the utilization on Cardano. 
- The definition of success: either time-bound, number of investments or the planned balance shift.
- The scope of the initiative: what kind of NFT's, since they are tied to real world assets, what type of assets are you looking at?
- How would this add value to the Cardano ecosystem. 

In general I do see the beginnings of a great idea, which I have seen implemented for real estate on the Algorand ecosystem, I don't see in your idea any metrics or goals to probably evaluate your idea, there is talk of a POC, but no mention of details.
f6_assessments.q1: No experience or plan presented for effective evaluation.
f6_assessments.q2: While this is a great idea, information provided is insufficient to audit progress or success.

solution: NFTs open the door to fractional ownership of digitized realworld assets. Some of these assets could be dividend paying and be freely traded
experience: Co-founder and CEO of swvlr ltd - a nascent software development start up.
